intro: Antirrhinum majus subsp. sempervirens, commonly known as the evergreen snapdragon, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, evergreen leaves and tall spikes of bright red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its persistent foliage, which sets it apart from other snapdragon varieties.
